title: A Bookmarks problem
content: I am a Golf Tragic and I hoard a lot of Golf Videos in my Bookmarks. Problem is now they are taking up too much space in my Bookmarks, so I am trying to work out how to set up in Bookmarks a generic Folder called Gold Stuff which will allow me to hoard all of these videos in just 1 spot. Thanks, Pete
creator: letchk1pk

title: Full screen mode watching streaming video not working
content: I watch a lot of sports on my large desktop monitor, mostly via "Watch ESPN using ESPN3, ESPN+, SEC, and ACC. Within the last few days going to full screen mode leaves me with narrow black bars on both sides and the bottom, with none at the top. This happens on my desktop and twp laptops that I use. This is happening in Firefox but Microsoft Edge is still showing these same videos with absolutely no borders, like Firefox used to do. I love Firefox but will be using Edge to watch my sports until this is resolved. I "sync" Firefox with all three computers so may some inadvertent setting is affecting them all. Strangely, this doesn't seem to be affecting You Tube
creator: sigsky

title: Why can't I load Firefox on my Windows 10 machine?
content:
Why can't I load Firefox on my Windows 10 machine?

I've cleaned out my temp folder. Now what?
creator: xboeing

title: Firefox still thinks I'm not in the UK after using VPN
content:
Hello

Recently I bought Nordic VPN and since I connected to one of its servers abroad, Firefox still thinks I'm outside the UK, even if I've switched to UK servers and even if I turn it off. So now I can't watch BBC iplayer.

I looked at other simliar threads but none of the solutions I read there works. I've cleared cache, switched to offline mode and online mode again, etc. Nothing.

I'm on Windows 10, 64-bit, desktop browser. Any tips on how to solve this would be great.

Best Aris
creator: arism74

title: Mozilla worked fine until today. Now either can't log into my USA network site or bypasses my Login so I can't work from my Home site
content: I have no idea. I thought the problem was site was overloaded. Message was too many logins. Then it let me in thru sites listed at bottom, but didn't have me log in, even if I logged out. i HAVE LOOKED AT HELPS, BUT SHOWS TOO MANY UNASSOCIATED ONES.
creator: d-s-strahan

title: Your reluctance to talk (never mind listen) to your users.
content:
My question: How do I disable "Download firefox update" nag?

More importantly; how do I stop your software -- running on MY computer -- from sending who knows what private information to your servers when it "checks for updates"?

But mostly, how did your once 32% market share fall to https://www.oberlo.com/statistics/browser-market-share|3%?

Maybe, because you stopped listening to your users and decided that "YOU KNOW BEST"!

The once champion of User rights now imposes itself on those few fools that continue to use it. You have to "sign up" to even ask a question. And woe betide that you want to enjoy a stable browser that doesn't force you to accept changes that break websites you rely upon, because some faceless, nameless do-gooder developer in Wisconsin decided ...

Engage me. I dare you to engage me. I won't swear at you. Nor accuse you *as an individual* of anything; but I will debunk your (the Mozilla collective) idea that "You know best".
creator: iDontWantAnAccountISimplyWantToAskAQuestion.20.browseruk
